title: Donje Bare
text:
Donje Bare (<a href="Serbian%20Cyrillic">Serbian Cyrillic</a>: Доње Баре) is a natural lake in <a href="Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">Bosnia and Herzegovina</a>, on the <a href="mountain">mountain</a> <a href="Zelengora">Zelengora</a>. It is located below the Ardov peak (1723). It is long and wide. The greatest depth of the lake is .
During the winter, the lake is completely ice-bound. <a href="Rainbow%20trout">Rainbow trout</a> is an <a href="invasive%20species">invasive species</a> that lives the lake. The water is clean and clear. It is filled with sources springing on the west coast. The bottom is dark blue. Around the lake are meadows and forests, a landscape of <a href="Alpine%20climate">alpine</a> pastures, covered with mountain grass, interspersed with scrub and <a href="pine">pine</a> trees, and in lower areas of <a href="beech">beech</a>.
